intro: Kostermanthus malayanus, commonly known as the Malayan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with opposite, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after species in horticulture.
